Col AJ Some months pay are brought in advacne and non payroll staff are paid in Chinese Yuan when the exchange rate is favourable.November included back dated pay rises and the contingent labour costs are higher in December due to a higher payment taking place in China in December. It is called the 13th month salary.
MACC has no contingent labour. Individual pieces of work are commissioned from the Association of Commonwealth Universities but on a management fee basis rather than relating to individuals.
Contingent labour works varied hours so the costs will vary

Its difficult to be specific about Contracctors cost as they mostly work out in the field so the costs come in when they have access to the system to book their time, they do accrue a standard week for them if they know they have been working but it’s a best guess scenario The costs will vary greatly depending on where the contractors are working, a lot of them will be overseas so the costs are higher as they work 10 hour days and often 6 days a week but if they are home it goes back to usual hours, some months there will be full teams overseas and some months they will at base preparing for the next job

The ICAI figure is zero for December. This figure represents the total costs for staff who are from another government department, the rest of the staff are paid from FCDO payroll therefore those staff costs are included in the figures for the FCDO paybills.
